intro: Galium murcicum, commonly known as the Murcia bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium murcicum is typically found in dry, open habitats such as rocky soils and disturbed areas. It is often used in traditional herbal remedies for its mild astringent properties.
